intro: Melanoseris lyrata, commonly known as the lyrata sericea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster that resembles a small, open umbrella. Melanoseris lyrata is often found in grassy areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
